item.title: Developer-driven development
item.description: The company I work for is slowly losing its “startup” status. I’m trying not to be too nostalgic about it. After all, it means we’re doing well; a slew of truly impressive awards and contracts in recent months means we’re doing great. There’s a lot to be grateful for. At the same time, a lot is changing. As this transition has played out, we’ve had to upgrade a few things.
